cards.name: Spirit Link
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

rulings.text: You only gain the life when the triggered ability resolves. If you are reduced to zero life before the ability resolves, you will lose before gaining the life.

You gain life for all damage which is not prevented, regardless of what the creature damages (player or another creature) or the toughness of the blocking creature. If you put this on a 5/5 and it is blocked by a 1/1, you still gain 5 life.

cards.originalText: For every point of damage target creature does, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Spiritual Sanctuary
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, if that player controls a Plains, they gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: All players with plains under his or her control gains 1 life point during upkeep.

cards.name: Thunder Spirit
cards.text: Flying, first strike
cards.flavor: "It was full of fire and smoke and light and . . . it drove between us and the Efrafans like a thousand thunderstorms with lightning." —Richard Adams, Watership Down
cards.originalText: First strike, flying.

cards.name: Tundra Wolves
cards.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor: I heard their eerie howling, the wolves calling their kindred across the frozen plains.
cards.originalText: First strike

cards.name: Visions
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of target player's library. You may then have that player shuffle that library.
cards.flavor:
"Visions of glory, spare my aching sight,/ Ye unborn ages, crowd not on my soul!"
—Thomas Gray, The Bard

rulings.text: You can't rearrange the cards. You put them back in the same order or have the whole library shuffled.
If there are less than 5 cards in the library, you look at whatever ones remain and you still get the option to shuffle.
This is not a draw and will not cause a player to lose if there are less than 5 cards in the library.

cards.originalText: You may look at the top five cards of any library. You may then choose to shuffle that library.

cards.name: Wall of Caltrops
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Wall of Caltrops blocks a creature, if at least one other Wall creature is blocking that creature and no non-Wall creatures are blocking that creature, Wall of Caltrops gains banding until end of turn. (If any creatures with banding you control are blocking a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by.)
cards.flavor: "Ow! Ow ow ow! Oooh, ow, OW!"

rulings.text: Banding is gained when the trigger resolves in the declare blockers step of the combat phase if the criterion is met.

cards.originalText: If Wall of Caltrops and one or more other walls join to block an attacker and no other creatures besides walls block that attacker, Wall of Caltrops gains banding ability until end of turn.

cards.name: Wall of Light
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Protection from black
cards.flavor: As many attackers were dazzled by the wall's beauty as were halted by its force.
cards.originalText: Protection from black

cards.name: Adun Oakenshield
cards.text: {B}{R}{G}, {T}: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: ". . . And at his passing, the bodies of the world's great warriors shall rise from their graves and follow him to battle." —The Anvilonian Grimoire
cards.originalText: {G}{R}{B}{T}: Select one creature from your graveyard and place it in your hand.

cards.name: Angus Mackenzie
cards.text: {G}{W}{U}, {T}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. Activate this ability only before the combat damage step.
cards.flavor: "Battles no longer served a purpose in Karakas." —Angus Mackenzie, Diary
cards.originalText: {W}{U}{G}{T}: Creatures attack and block as normal, but none deal any damage during combat. All attacking creatures are still tapped. Use this ability any time before attack damage is dealt.

cards.name: Arcades Sabboth
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Arcades Sabboth unless you pay {G}{W}{U}.
Each untapped creature you control gets +0/+2 as long as it's not attacking.
{W}: Arcades Sabboth gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: As long as Arcades Sabboth is untapped and isn't attacking, it'll get +0/+2 from its own third ability.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{W}: +0/+1 until end of turn.
Your untapped creatures gain +0/+2. Attacking creatures do not get this bonus. Pay {W}{G}{U} during your upkeep or Arcades Sabboth is buried.

cards.name: Axelrod Gunnarson
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Axelrod Gunnarson this turn dies, you gain 1 life and Axelrod deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.

rulings.text: Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from play, check whether Axelrod Gunnarson had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. (This includes combat damage.) If so, Axelrod Gunnarson's second ability will trigger. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Axelrod Gunnarson and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Axelrod Gunnarson's second ability will trigger.
The player you target with Axelrod Gunnarson's ability doesn't have to be the player that controlled the creature that was put into a graveyard.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Each time a creature is placed in the graveyard during a turn in which Axelrod damaged it, you gain 1 life and Axelrod does 1 damage to target player.

cards.name: Ayesha Tanaka
cards.text:
Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
{T}: Counter target activated ability from an artifact source unless that ability's controller pays {W}. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText:
Banding
{T}: Artifact effect which requires an activation cost is countered unless its controller spends {W}. This ability is played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Barktooth Warbeard
cards.flavor: He is devious and cunning, in both appearance and deed. Beware the Warbeard, for this brute bites as well as he barks!

cards.name: Bartel Runeaxe
cards.text:
Vigilance
Bartel Runeaxe can't be the target of Aura spells.
cards.flavor: Thundering down from Hammerheim, no foe could slow Bartel's charge.

rulings.text: Bartel Runeaxe can be targeted by the abilities of enchantments, including Auras.
This card can be enchanted by moving Auras onto it. The "can't be the target" text is different from "can't be enchanted" in that it only applies to Aura spells when they are being cast.

cards.originalText: Bartel Runeaxe cannot be the target of enchant creature spells. Attacking does not cause Bartel Runeaxe to tap.

cards.name: Boris Devilboon
cards.text: {2}{B}{R}, {T}: Create a 1/1 black and red Demon creature token named Minor Demon.
cards.originalText: {2}{B}{R}{T}: Put a minor demon token into play. Treat this token as a 1/1 red and black creature.

cards.name: Chromium
cards.text:
Flying
Rampage 2 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Chromium unless you pay {W}{U}{B}.
cards.originalText:
Flying, Rampage: 2
Pay {B}{U}{W} during your upkeep or Chromium is buried.

cards.name: Dakkon Blackblade
cards.text: Dakkon Blackblade's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.
cards.flavor: "My power is as vast as the plains, my strength is that of mountains. Each wave that crashes upon the shore thunders like blood in my veins." —Memoirs
cards.originalText: The *s below equal the number of lands you control.

cards.name: Gabriel Angelfire
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, choose flying, first strike, trample, or rampage 3. Gabriel Angelfire gains that ability until your next upkeep. (Whenever a creature with rampage 3 becomes blocked, it gets +3/+3 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)

rulings.text: Gabriel Angelfire will have the ability it gains through your next untap step, but will no longer have it during your next upkeep step.

cards.originalText: During your upkeep, Gabriel gains one of the following abilities until your next upkeep: flying, first strike, trample, or rampage: 3.

cards.name: Gosta Dirk
cards.text:
First strike
Creatures with islandwalk can be blocked as though they didn't have islandwalk.
cards.originalText:
First strike
Creatures with islandwalk may be blocked as if they did not have this ability.

cards.name: Gwendlyn Di Corci
cards.text: {T}: Target player discards a card at random. Activate this ability only during your turn.
cards.flavor: Urborg became the final resting place of many swordsmen of renown, their steel outmatched by the wiles of Gwendlyn.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target player discards one card from his or her hand at random. This power may only be used during your turn.

cards.name: Halfdane
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, change Halfdane's base power and toughness to the power and toughness of target creature other than Halfdane until the end of your next upkeep.
cards.flavor: Hail from Tolaria the ever changing 'Dane.

rulings.text: You apply power/toughness changing effects in a series of sublayers in the following order: (a) effects from characteristic-defining abilities; (b) effects that set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (c) effects that modify power and/or toughness but don't set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (d) changes from counters; (e) effects that switch a creature's power and toughness. This card's effect is always applied in (b), which means that effects applied in sublayer (c), (d), or (e) will not be overwritten; they will be applied to the new value.

Note that the duration of Halfdane's ability is until the end of your next upkeep. If Halfdane's ability doesn't get a chance to resolve (because there are no legal targets when it triggers, or because it's countered), then the effect from the previous turn's ability will continue to work through the rest of that upkeep step. Then that effect will wear off, and Halfdane will revert to being 3/3, its printed power and toughness (unless some other effect is modifying what its power and toughness is).

cards.originalText: When Halfdane comes into play he is 3/3. During your upkeep, Halfdane acquires the current power and toughness of target creature other than Halfdane. If there are no legal targets, Halfdane becomes 3/3.

cards.name: Hazezon Tamar
cards.text:
When Hazezon Tamar enters the battlefield, create X 1/1 Sand Warrior creature tokens that are red, green, and white at the beginning of your next upkeep, where X is the number of lands you control at that time.
When Hazezon leaves the battlefield, exile all Sand Warriors.

rulings.text: When Hazezon Tamar's second ability resolves, all permanents with both the Sand and Warrior creature types are exiled, not just the Sand Warrior creature tokens it created. Permanents that have just one of those types are unaffected.

The first ability creates a delayed triggered ability that triggers at the beginning of your next upkeep. It doesn't matter who controls Hazezon Tamar at that time, or even if it's on the battlefield. The player who put Hazezon onto the battlefield gets the Sand Warriors.

Only Sand Warriors that are actually on the battlefield when Hazezon Tamar leaves the battlefield are affected when its second ability resolves. If Hazezon leaves the battlefield after the delayed triggered ability created by its first ability triggers but before that ability resolves, its second ability triggers and resolves first, then the Sand Warriors are put on the battlefield. Those Sand Warriors will remain on the battlefield indefinitely.

cards.originalText: On your next upkeep after Hazezon is put into play, put * token Sand Warriors into play, where * is the number of lands under your control. Treat the Warriors as 1/1 white, green, and red creatures. If Hazezon leaves play, all Sand Warriors are also removed from game.

cards.name: Hunding Gjornersen
cards.text: Rampage 1 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
cards.flavor: "You would never guess, at the terrifying sight of the man, that Hunding was as charming a companion as one could wish for."
cards.originalText: Rampage: 1

cards.name: Jacques le Vert
cards.text: Green creatures you control get +0/+2.
cards.flavor: Abandoning his sword to return to the lush forest of Pendelhaven, Jacques le Vert devoted his life to protecting the creatures of his homeland.

rulings.text: Gives himself +0/+2.

cards.originalText: All your green creatures gain +0/+2.

cards.name: Jasmine Boreal
cards.flavor: "Peace must prevail, even if the wicked must die."

cards.name: Jedit Ojanen
cards.flavor: Mightiest of the Cat Warriors, Jedit Ojanen forsook the forests of his tribe and took service with the Robaran Mercenaries, rising through their ranks to lead them in the battle for Efrava.

cards.name: Jerrard of the Closed Fist
cards.flavor: Once, the order of the Closed Fist reached throughout the Kb'Briann Highlands. Now, Jerrard alone remains to uphold their standard.

cards.name: Johan
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may have Johan gain "Johan can't attack" until end of combat. If you do, attacking doesn't cause creatures you control to tap this combat if Johan is untapped.
cards.originalText: If Johan does not attack and is not tapped, any of your creatures may attack without tapping.

cards.name: Kasimir the Lone Wolf
cards.flavor: Popular indeed is the tale of how Kasimir was once a Holy man who renounced his order to take up the sword. But this tale is no more likely than any other.

cards.name: Kei Takahashi
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
cards.originalText: {T}: Prevent up to 2 damage to one creature.

cards.name: Lady Caleria
cards.text: {T}: Lady Caleria deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.originalText: {T}: Lady Caleria does 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.name: Lady Evangela
cards.text: {W}{B}, {T}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target creature this turn.
cards.flavor: "When milady was young, the sight of a rainbow would fill her soul with peace. As she grew, she learned to share her rapture with others." —Lady Gabriella
cards.originalText: {B}{W}{T}: Target creature does no damage during combat this turn.

cards.name: Lady Orca
cards.flavor: "I do not remember what he said to her. I remember her fiery eyes, fixed upon him for an instant. I remember a flash, and the hot breath of sudden flames made me turn away. When I looked again, Angus was gone." —A Wayfarer, on meeting Lady Orca

cards.name: Livonya Silone
cards.text: First strike; legendary landwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a legendary land.)
cards.flavor: Livonya's own nature is a matter of mystery. Nothing is known for sure, merely rumors of unearthly stealth, and unholy alliances.

rulings.text: "Legendary landwalk" means "This creature is can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a legendary land."

cards.originalText: First strike, Legendary Land-walk.

cards.name: Lord Magnus
cards.text:
First strike
Creatures with plainswalk can be blocked as though they didn't have plainswalk.
Creatures with forestwalk can be blocked as though they didn't have forestwalk.

rulings.text: The statement that creatures with Plainswalk or Forestwalk can be blocked applies to all creatures on the battlefield blocking them, and not just to Lord Magnus.

cards.originalText:
First strike
Creatures with plainswalk or forestwalk may be blocked as if they did not have either ability.

cards.name: Marhault Elsdragon
cards.text: Rampage 1 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
cards.flavor: Marhault follows a strict philosophy, never letting emotions cloud his thoughts. No chance observer could imagine the rage in his heart.
cards.originalText: Rampage: 1

cards.name: Nebuchadnezzar
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Choose a card name. Target opponent reveals X cards at random from their hand. Then that player discards all cards with that name revealed this way. Activate this ability only during your turn.

rulings.text: You don't name a card until the ability resolves. Once you name a card, it's too late for the targeted opponent to respond.
You may activate the ability only during your turn, but you may do so any time you have priority. (In other words, it's not restricted to only the times you could cast a sorcery.)

cards.originalText: {X}{T}: Name a card. Opponent reveals X cards from his or her hand at random, or entire hand if he or she does not have enough cards. Opponent then discards any of those cards that match the one you named. May only use this power during your turn.

cards.name: Nicol Bolas
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Nicol Bolas unless you pay {U}{B}{R}.
Whenever Nicol Bolas deals damage to an opponent, that player discards their hand.

rulings.text: Nicol Bolas's third ability triggers whenever it deals damage to an opponent for any reason. It's not limited to combat damage.

cards.originalText:
Flying
An opponent damaged by Nicol Bolas must discard entire hand. Ignore this effect if opponent has no cards left in hand. Pay {U}{B}{R} during your upkeep or Nicol Bolas is buried.

cards.name: Palladia-Mors
cards.text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Palladia-Mors unless you pay {R}{G}{W}.
cards.originalText:
Flying, Trample
Pay {W}{G}{R} during your upkeep or Palladia-Mors is buried.

cards.name: Pavel Maliki
cards.text: {B}{R}: Pavel Maliki gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: We all know the legend: Pavel wanders the realms, helping those in greatest need. But is this a measure of his generosity, or of his obligation to atone?
cards.originalText: {B}{R}: +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Princess Lucrezia
cards.text: {T}: Add {U}.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
This ability is played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Ragnar
cards.text: {G}{W}{U}, {T}: Regenerate target creature.
cards.flavor: "On the field of honor, a soldier need have no fear."
cards.originalText: {W}{U}{G}{T}: Regenerate target creature.

cards.name: Ramirez DePietro
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor: Ramirez DePietro is a most flamboyant pirate. Be careful not to believe his tall tales, especially when you ask his age.
cards.originalText: First strike

cards.name: Ramses Overdark
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target enchanted creature.

rulings.text: A creature is "enchanted" if it has any Auras attached to it.

cards.originalText: {T}: Destroys a target creature which has an enchantment card played on it.

cards.name: Rasputin Dreamweaver
cards.text:
Rasputin Dreamweaver enters the battlefield with seven dream counters on it.
Remove a dream counter from Rasputin: Add {C}.
Remove a dream counter from Rasputin: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Rasputin this turn.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Rasputin started the turn untapped, put a dream counter on it.
Rasputin can't have more than seven dream counters on it.

rulings.text: The fourth ability has an "intervening 'if' clause," so it won't trigger at all unless Rasputin Dreamweaver started the turn untapped.

If a number of dream counters would be put on Rasputin Dreamweaver for any reason that would bring the total number of dream counters on it to eight or more, the total number of dream counters on it is brought to seven instead.

If a permanent with eight or more dream counters on it becomes a copy of Rasputin Dreamweaver (or just gains its last ability), all dream counters except seven are removed from it as a state-based action.

cards.originalText: Put seven counters on Rasputin when brought into play. You may remove a counter to prevent one damage to Rasputin or add {1} to your mana pool. This ability is played as an interrupt. Put one counter on Rasputin during your upkeep if he started the turn untapped. You may not have more than seven of these counters on Rasputin at any time.

cards.name: Riven Turnbull
cards.text: {T}: Add {B}.
cards.flavor: "Political violence is a perfectly legitimate answer to the persecution handed down by dignitaries of the state."
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool. This ability is played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Rohgahh of Kher Keep
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {R}{R}{R}. If you don't, tap Rohgahh of Kher Keep and all creatures named Kobolds of Kher Keep, then an opponent gains control of them.
Creatures you control named Kobolds of Kher Keep get +2/+2.

rulings.text: Rohgahh's first ability isn't targeted. You don't choose the opponent that will gain control of the creatures until the ability resolves.

If you don't pay {R}{R}{R} as the first ability resolves, all creatures named Kobolds of Kher Keep become tapped (even the ones you don't control), as does Rohgahh. The chosen opponent gains control of Rohgahh and all creatures named Kobolds of Kher Keep regardless of whether you control them or whether they were tapped by the ability.

cards.originalText: All your Kobolds of Kher Keep gain +2/+2. Pay {R}{R}{R} during your upkeep, or Rohgahh and all Kobolds of Kher Keep become tapped and come under opponent's control.

cards.name: Rubinia Soulsinger
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Rubinia Soulsinger during your untap step.
{T}: Gain control of target creature for as long as you control Rubinia and Rubinia remains tapped.

rulings.text: If Rubinia Soulsinger leaves the battlefield, you no longer control it, so the duration of its control-change effect ends.

If Rubinia Soulsinger stops being tapped before its ability resolves — even if it becomes tapped again right away — you won't gain control of the targeted creature at all. The same is true if you lose control of Rubinia Soulsinger before the ability resolves.

Once the ability resolves, it doesn't care whether the targeted permanent remains a legal target for the ability, only that it's on the battlefield. The effect will continue to apply to it even if it gains shroud, stops being a creature, or would no longer be a legal target for any other reason.

cards.originalText: {T}: Gain control of target creature. Rubinia does not tap or untap this creature. If Rubinia becomes untapped you lose control of this creature; you may choose not to untap Rubinia as normal during your untap phase. You also lose control of target creature if either Rubinia leaves play or you lose control of Rubinia.

cards.name: Sir Shandlar of Eberyn
cards.flavor: "Remember Sir Shandlar! Remember and stand firm!" —rallying cry of the Eberyn militia

cards.name: Sivitri Scarzam
cards.flavor: Even the brave have cause to tremble at the sight of Sivitri Scarzam. Who else has tamed Scarzam's Dragon?

cards.name: Sol'kanar the Swamp King
cards.text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Whenever a player casts a black spell, you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: Will not trigger off itself being cast.

cards.originalText:
Swampwalk
Sol'kanar's controller gains 1 life each time a black spell is cast.

cards.name: Stangg
cards.text: When Stangg enters the battlefield, create a legendary 3/4 red and green Human Warrior creature token named Stangg Twin. Exile that token when Stangg leaves the battlefield. Sacrifice Stangg when that token leaves the battlefield.

rulings.text: If Stangg leaves the battlefield before its ability has resolved, that ability will still create a Stangg Twin token, but its delayed triggered ability that exiles the token will never have a chance to trigger. That token will remain on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: When Stangg is brought into play, also put a Stangg Twin token into play. Stangg Twin token is a 3/4 green and red legend. If Stangg leaves play, remove Stangg Twin token from game. If Stangg Twin leaves play, bury Stangg.

cards.name: Sunastian Falconer
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}{C}.
cards.flavor: Sunastian has roots in both sorcery and swordplay; he has learned never to depend too heavily on the latter.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool. This ability is played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Tetsuo Umezawa
cards.text:
Tetsuo Umezawa can't be the target of Aura spells.
{U}{B}{B}{R}, {T}: Destroy target tapped or blocking creature.

rulings.text: This card can be enchanted by moving Auras onto it. The "can't be the target" text is different from "can't be enchanted" in that it only applies to Aura spells when they are being cast.
Tetsuo Umezawa can be targeted by abilities from Auras.

cards.originalText: {R}{B}{B}{U}{T}: Destroy target tapped creature or target blocking creature. Tetsuo may not be a target of an enchant creature spell.

cards.name: The Lady of the Mountain
cards.flavor: Her given name has been lost in the mists of time. Legend says that her silent vigil will one day be ended by the one who, pure of heart and spirit, calls out that name again.

cards.name: The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale
cards.text: All creatures have "At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy this creature unless you pay {1}."
cards.originalText: All creatures now require an upkeep cost of {1} in addition to any other upkeep costs they may have. If the upkeep cost for a creature is not paid, the creature is destroyed.

cards.name: Tobias Andrion
cards.flavor: Administrator of the military state of Sheoltun, Tobias is the military right arm of the empire and the figurehead of its freedom.

cards.name: Tor Wauki
cards.text: {T}: Tor Wauki deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.originalText: {T}: Tor Wauki does 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.name: Torsten Von Ursus
cards.flavor: "How can you accuse me of evil? Though these deeds be unsavory, no one will argue: good shall follow from them."

cards.name: Tuknir Deathlock
cards.text:
Flying
{R}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: An explorer of the Æther, Tuknir often discovers himself in the most unusual physical realms.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{G}{R}{T}: Target creature gains +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ur-Drago
cards.text:
First strike
Creatures with swampwalk can be blocked as though they didn't have swampwalk.

rulings.text: Allows any creature controlled by any player to block Swampwalking creatures as if they did not have this ability. It is not limited to just Ur-Drago.

cards.originalText:
First strike
Creatures with swampwalk may be blocked as if they did not have this ability.

cards.name: Vaevictis Asmadi
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Vaevictis Asmadi unless you pay {B}{R}{G}.
{B}: Vaevictis Asmadi gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{R}: Vaevictis Asmadi gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{G}: Vaevictis Asmadi gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{B}: Gain +1/+0 until end of turn.
{R}: Gain +1/+0 until end of turn.
{G}: Gain +1/+0 until end of turn.
Pay {B}{R}{G} during your upkeep or Vaevictis Asmadi is buried.

cards.name: Xira Arien
cards.text:
Flying
{B}{R}{G}, {T}: Target player draws a card.
cards.flavor: A regular guest at the Royal Masquerade, Arien is the envy of the Court. She appears in a new costume every hour.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{G}{R}{B}{T}: Target player draws one card.

cards.name: Adventurers' Guildhouse
cards.text: Green legendary creatures you control have "bands with other legendary creatures." (Any legendary creatures can attack in a band as long as at least one has "bands with other legendary creatures." Bands are blocked as a group. If at least two legendary creatures you control, one of which has "bands with other legendary creatures," are blocking or being blocked by the same creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.originalText: All your green legends gain bands with other legends.

cards.name: Cathedral of Serra
cards.text: White legendary creatures you control have "bands with other legendary creatures." (Any legendary creatures can attack in a band as long as at least one has "bands with other legendary creatures." Bands are blocked as a group. If at least two legendary creatures you control, one of which has "bands with other legendary creatures," are blocking or being blocked by the same creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.originalText: All your white legends gain bands with other legends.

cards.name: Hammerheim
cards.text:
{T}: Add {R}.
{T}: Target creature loses all landwalk abilities until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "'Tis distance lends enchantment to the view,/ And robes the mountain in its azure hue." —Thomas Campbell, "Pleasures of Hope"

rulings.text: This can be used on a creature without landwalking but has no effect.
Causing a creature to lose landwalk abilities is useful only during the declare attackers step or earlier. Once the declare blockers step begins, it's too late to block the creature.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool
{T}: Remove all landwalking ability from target creature until end of turn.

cards.name: Karakas
cards.text:
{T}: Add {W}.
{T}: Return target legendary creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "To make a prairie it takes a clover and one bee,/ One clover, and a bee,/ And revery." —Emily Dickinson
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool
{T}: Return target legend to owner's hand; enchantments on target legend are destroyed.

cards.name: Mountain Stronghold
cards.text: Red legendary creatures you control have "bands with other legendary creatures." (Any legendary creatures can attack in a band as long as at least one has "bands with other legendary creatures." Bands are blocked as a group. If at least two legendary creatures you control, one of which has "bands with other legendary creatures," are blocking or being blocked by the same creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.originalText: All your red legends may band with other legends.

cards.name: Pendelhaven
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G}.
{T}: Target 1/1 creature gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "This is the forest primeval. The murmuring pines and the hemlocks . . . / Stand like Druids of old." —Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, "Evangeline"

rulings.text: The current power/toughness being 1/1 is a targeting requirement so it is checked when announcing and again right before resolving.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool
{T}: Target 1/1 creature gains +1/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Seafarer's Quay
cards.text: Blue legendary creatures you control have "bands with other legendary creatures." (Any legendary creatures can attack in a band as long as at least one has "bands with other legendary creatures." Bands are blocked as a group. If at least two legendary creatures you control, one of which has "bands with other legendary creatures," are blocking or being blocked by the same creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.originalText: All your blue legends gain bands with other legends.

cards.name: Tolaria
cards.text:
{T}: Add {U}.
{T}: Target creature loses banding and all "bands with other" abilities until end of turn. Activate this ability only during any upkeep step.
cards.flavor: "Fairest Isle, all isles excelling,/ Seat of pleasures, and of loves . . ." —John Dryden
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool
{T}: During upkeep remove the banding or bands with other ability from target creature until end of turn.

cards.name: Unholy Citadel
cards.text: Black legendary creatures you control have "bands with other legendary creatures." (Any legendary creatures can attack in a band as long as at least one has "bands with other legendary creatures." Bands are blocked as a group. If at least two legendary creatures you control, one of which has "bands with other legendary creatures," are blocking or being blocked by the same creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.originalText: All your black legends gain bands with other legends.

cards.name: Urborg
cards.text:
{T}: Add {B}.
{T}: Target creature loses first strike or swampwalk until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Resignedly beneath the sky/The melancholy waters lie./So blend the turrets and shadows there/That all seem pendulous in air,/While from a proud tower in town/Death looks gigantically down." —Edgar Allan Poe, "The City in the Sea"

rulings.text: The ability can be used on a creature without First Strike or Swampwalk but has no effect.
If a creature loses first strike after first strike combat damage has been assigned, it won't deal damage during the second combat damage step.
You choose whether the targeted creature loses first strike or swampwalk as the ability resolves. If the creature has both abilities, it will lose just one of them.
Causing a creature to lose swampwalk is useful only during the declare attackers step or earlier. Once the declare blockers step begins, it's too late to block the creature.
Urborg's second ability affects only the first strike ability, not the part of the double strike ability that acts like first strike.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool
{T}: Remove first strike ability or swampwalk ability from target creature until end of turn.

cards.name: Ankh of Mishra
cards.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, Ankh of Mishra deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

rulings.text: This triggers on any land entering the battlefield. This includes playing a land or putting a land onto the battlefield using a spell or ability.
It determines the land's controller at the time the ability resolves. If the land leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the land's last controller before it left is used.

cards.originalText: Ankh does 2 damage to anyone who puts a new land into play.

cards.name: Basalt Monolith
cards.text:
Basalt Monolith doesn't untap during your untap step.
{T}: Add {C}{C}{C}.
{3}: Untap Basalt Monolith.

rulings.text: It can be untapped as often as you can pay for it.

cards.originalText: Tap to add 3 colorless mana to your mana pool. Does not untap as normal during untap phase; spend {3} to untap. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Black Lotus
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Black Lotus: Add three mana of any one color.
cards.originalText: Adds 3 mana of any single color of your choice to your mana pool, then is discarded. Tapping this artifact can be played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Black Vise
cards.text:
As Black Vise enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, Black Vise deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in their hand minus 4.

rulings.text: You choose one opposing player as it enters the battlefield and it only affects that one player. This choice is not changed even if Black Vise changes controllers. It becomes useless but stays on the battlefield if that player leaves the game.
If the chosen player has four or fewer cards in their hand as Black Vise's ability resolves, the ability just won't do anything that turn.

cards.originalText: If opponent has more than four cards in hand during upkeep, black vise does 1 damage to opponent for each card in excess of four.

cards.name: Celestial Prism
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.originalText: {2}: Provides 1 mana of any color. This use can be played as an interrupt.

cards.name: Chaos Orb
cards.text: {1}, {T}: If Chaos Orb is on the battlefield, flip Chaos Orb onto the battlefield from a height of at least one foot. If Chaos Orb turns over completely at least once during the flip, destroy all nontoken permanents it touches. Then destroy Chaos Orb.

rulings.text: Chaos Orb can only affect permanents. Cards that are in the game but not on the battlefield, such as those in the Library and Graveyard, can't be affected.

You can arrange your cards any time before the Orb is put onto the battlefield, but not after. In general, you should not stack cards or put them in places where your opponent can't read the names of all of them or count them. This is recommended good gaming practice.
It must flip 360 degrees (that's what "flip" means). And this flip must be in the air and not in your hand.
This is a not a targeted ability.
If you have sleeves on cards, they count as the cards.
You can't interfere in any physical way with activating this ability.

cards.originalText: {1}: Flip Chaos Orb onto the playing area from a height of at least one foot. Chaos Orb must turn completely over at least once or it is discarded with no effect. When Chaos Orb lands, any cards in play that it touches are destroyed, as is Chaos Orb.

cards.name: Clockwork Beast
cards.text:
Clockwork Beast enters the battlefield with seven +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Beast attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast to be greater than seven. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
This is a change from the most recent wording. Now, if some other spell or ability causes +1/+0 counters to be put on Clockwork Beast, it can wind up with more than seven such counters on it.

If Clockwork Beast has seven or fewer +1/+0 counters on it when its last ability resolves, it can wind up a maximum of seven such counters on it. If it has seven or more +1/+0 counters on it, the ability will have no effect.
Clockwork Beast's last ability resolves, you can choose to put fewer than X +1/+0 counters on it.

cards.originalText: Put seven +1/+0 counters on Beast. After Beast attacks or blocks a creature, discard a counter. During the untap phase, controller may buy back lost counters for 1 mana per counter instead of tapping Beast; this taps Beast if it wasn't tapped already.

cards.name: Conservator
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.
cards.originalText: {3}: Prevent the loss of up to 2 life.

cards.name: Copper Tablet
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Copper Tablet deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.originalText: Copper Tablet does 1 damage to each player during his or her upkeep.

cards.name: Crystal Rod
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: {1}: Any blue spell cast by any player gives you 1 life.

cards.name: Cyclopean Tomb
cards.text:
{2}, {T}: Put a mire counter on target non-Swamp land. That land is a Swamp for as long as it has a mire counter on it. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
When Cyclopean Tomb is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, at the beginning of each of your upkeeps for the rest of the game, remove all mire counters from a land that a mire counter was put onto with Cyclopean Tomb but that a mire counter has not been removed from with Cyclopean Tomb.

rulings.text: Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

After leaving the battlefield, the ability triggers during each of your upkeeps for the rest of the game. As it resolves, you must remove a mire counter from a land that had a mire counter put on it by that instance of Cyclopean Tomb, but it doesn't matter where the mire counter you remove came from. For instance, you could remove mire counters that were put on the land by Gilder Bairn.
The land remains a Swamp as long as it has a mire counter on it. This effect is not tied to the Tomb remaining on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: {2}: Turn any one non-swamp land into swamp during upkeep. Mark the changed lands with tokens. If Cyclopean Tomb is destroyed, remove one token of your choice each upkeep, returning that land to its original nature.

cards.name: Dingus Egg
cards.text: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
cards.originalText: Whenever anyone loses a land, Egg does 2 damage to that player for each land lost.

cards.name: Disrupting Scepter
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.

rulings.text: You can use it on yourself.

cards.originalText: {3}: Opponent must discard one card of his or her choice. Can only be used during your turn.

cards.name: Forcefield
cards.text: {1}: The next time an unblocked creature of your choice would deal combat damage to you this turn, prevent all but 1 of that damage.

rulings.text: This can't be used to prevent damage caused by a blocked creature with Trample ability.

cards.originalText: {1}: Lose only 1 life to an unblocked creature.

cards.name: Gauntlet of Might
cards.text:
Red creatures get +1/+1.
Whenever a Mountain is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional {R}.

rulings.text: Dual lands which have Mountain as one of their types produce an extra red mana when tapped for either color.

cards.originalText: All red creatures gain +1/+1 and all mountains provide an extra red mana when tapped.

cards.name: Glasses of Urza
cards.text: {T}: Look at target player's hand.
cards.originalText: You may look at opponent's hand.

cards.name: Helm of Chatzuk
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Target creature gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding a player controls are blocking or being blocked by a creature, that player divides that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText: {1}: You may give one creature the ability to band until end of turn.

cards.name: Howling Mine
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.

rulings.text: If Howling Mine leaves the battlefield before it resolves, then the last known tap or untap state of the card is used for resolution.
It does not trigger at all if this is tapped at the start of the draw step, and it checks this again on resolution.
The additional draw is separate from any other draw during your draw step. It happens when the triggered ability resolves.
The triggered ability is put onto the stack after you have already drawn your card for the turn.

cards.originalText: Each player draws one extra card each turn during his or her draw phase.

cards.name: Icy Manipulator
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.

rulings.text: Once a player announces that they're casting a spell or activating an ability, no player may take other actions until the spell or ability has been paid for. Notably, other players can't try to tap that player's permanents to stop them from paying {T} or to stop them from producing enough mana.

cards.originalText: {1}: You may tap any land, creature, or artifact in play on either side. No effects are generated by the target card.

cards.name: Illusionary Mask
cards.text: {X}: You may choose a creature card in your hand whose mana cost could be paid by some amount of, or all of, the mana you spent on {X}. If you do, you may cast that card face down as a 2/2 creature spell without paying its mana cost. If the creature that spell becomes as it resolves has not been turned face up and would assign or deal damage, be dealt damage, or become tapped, instead it's turned face up and assigns or deals damage, is dealt damage, or becomes tapped. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

rulings.text: The creature enters the battlefield face down, so none of its "enters the battlefield" abilities will trigger or have any effect. Also none of its "As this enters the battlefield" abilities apply.
The creature's "enters the battlefield" abilities (and any other abilities relating to the creature entering the battlefield) do not trigger when it turns face up.
Only the controller of the face down creature can look at it.

If you use the ability to cast a creature card face down, you must keep track of the amount and types of mana you spent on {X}. If that creature spell is moved from the stack to anywhere other than the battlefield, the resulting creature leaves the battlefield, or the game ends, the face-down card is revealed. If its mana cost couldn't be paid by some amount of, or all of, the mana you spent on {X}, all applicable penalties for casting a card illegally are assessed.
You actually cast the card face-down, much as when playing a spell with Morph. It can be responded to and countered.
The effect that turns it face-up is a replacement effect. It doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to.

You may not turn a face-down spell face up. You may not turn a face-down permanent face up unless it would have morph while face up or an effect specifically allows you to turn it face up. Illusionary Mask's ability has you turn a face-down creature face up if it would assign damage, deal damage, be dealt damage, or become tapped, but not for any other reason. For example, if you use Illusionary Mask's ability to cast a black creature face down, you can't turn it face up just because it's being targeted by Terror.

Both the amount and types of mana you spend on {X} are taken into account while you're choosing a creature card from your hand. For example, if you spent {U}{U} on {X}, you can choose a creature card with mana cost {U}{U}, {1}{U}, {2}, or {W/U}{W/U}, among other possibilities, but not one that costs {2}{U} or one that costs {G}.
While the creature card is face down, it's a 2/2 creature with no name, mana cost, color, creature type, abilities, or expansion symbol. Since it has no mana cost, its converted mana cost is 0.
You may look at a face-down spell or permanent you control at any time.

You can turn a face-down permanent face up if it would have morph while face up. This applies to creatures you cast face down as a result of Illusionary Mask's effect. The rest of Illusionary Mask's effect applies to it as well.
Illusionary Mask's ability will continue to apply to creatures cast face down with it, even if Illusionary Mask has left the battlefield.

cards.originalText: {X}: You can summon a creature face down so opponent doesn't know what it is. The X cost can be any amount of mana, even 0; it serves to hide the true casting cost of the creature, which you still have to spend. As soon as a face-down creature receives damage, deals damage, or is tapped, you must turn it face up.

cards.name: Iron Star
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: {1}: Any red spell cast by any player gives you 1 life.

cards.name: Ivory Cup
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: {1}: Any white spell cast by any player gives you 1 life.

cards.name: Jade Monolith
cards.text: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that source deals that damage to you instead.
cards.originalText: {1}: You may take damage done to any creature on yourself instead, but you must take all of it. Source of damage is unchanged.

cards.name: Jade Statue
cards.text: {2}: Jade Statue becomes a 3/6 Golem artifact creature until end of combat. Activate this ability only during combat.
cards.flavor: "Some of the other guys dared me to touch it, but I knew it weren't no ordinary hunk o' rock." —Norin the Wary

rulings.text: It can only make itself into a creature during combat phases and therefore it is difficult to get Auras placed on it.

A delayed triggered ability that refers to Jade Statue still affects it even if it's no longer a creature. For example, if Jade Statue blocks the Kashi-Tribe Warriors ("Whenever Kashi-Tribe Warriors deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step."), the Warriors' effect stops Jade Statue from untapping.
If Jade Statue's ability has been activated, abilities that trigger "at end of combat" will see Jade Statue as an artifact creature.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

If Jade Statue is animated by some other effect, you get an artifact creature with whatever power, toughness, and creature types (if any) are specified by that effect. If you subsequently use Jade Statue's ability during combat, it will become 3/6 and gain the creature type Golem in addition to those creature types until end of combat.

cards.originalText: {2}: Jade Statue becomes a creature for the duration of the current attack exchange. Can be a creature only during an attack or defense.

cards.name: Jayemdae Tome
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.
cards.originalText: {4}: You may draw one extra card.

cards.name: Juggernaut
cards.text:
Juggernaut attacks each combat if able.
Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.
cards.flavor: We had taken refuge in a small cave, thinking the entrance was too narrow for it to follow. To our horror, its gigantic head smashed into the mountainside, ripping itself a new entrance.

rulings.text: If Juggernaut can't attack for any reason (such as being tapped or having come under that player's control that turn), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having it attack, its controller isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

cards.originalText: Must attack each turn if possible. Can't be blocked by walls.

cards.name: Kormus Bell
cards.text: All Swamps are 1/1 black creatures that are still lands.

rulings.text: The lands are both lands and creatures at the same time. They are affected by anything that affects either permanent type.
It affects Swamps controlled by any and all players.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: Treat all swamps in play as 1/1 creatures. Now they can be enchanted, killed, and so forth, and they can be tapped either for mana or to attack. Swamps have no color; they are not considered black cards.
